html: Keep your food safe during a power outage to avoid foodborne illness. Key tips to remember 1. Keep fridge & freezer doors closed. 2. Food in fridge is safe for up to 4 hours. 3. Food in freezer is safe for up to 48 hours (if full). #HurricaneLanepic.twitter.com/dJRu0g6vaq
text:
Keep your food safe during a power outage to avoid foodborne illness. Key tips to remember 
1. Keep fridge & freezer doors closed.
2. Food in fridge is safe for up to 4 hours.
3. Food in freezer is safe for up to 48 hours (if full).
#HurricaneLanepic.twitter.com/dJRu0g6vaq

inches of rain has already fallen at a couple locations on the

html: Due to the magnitude of hurricane, there will likely be power outages. Please plan for it. We will do our best to restore power when it is safe to do so. Mahalo.
text: Due to the magnitude of hurricane, there will likely be power outages. Please plan for it. We will do our best to restore power when it is safe to do so. Mahalo.

text:
Hawaii: There are times when cell phone signals fail or alerts don't reach every phone. If possible, have different ways to get informed during the storm, like battery-operated radio, TV, computer, and phone. 
Also, check local emergency websites & social accounts. #HurricaneLanepic.twitter.com/LSBWoLnkRM

html: #HurricanePrep tip: Cover all of your home’s windows. Permanent storm shutters offer the best protection for windows. A second option is to board up windows with 5/8” exterior grade or marine plywood, cut to fit and ready to install. http://www.ready.gov/hurricanes  #HurricaneLanepic.twitter.com/z5q6DySg5f

html: UPDATE: #Lane is officially a dangerous category 5 storm with maximum sustained winds of 160mph. Lane is only one of two category 5 hurricanes to pass within 350 miles of the state according to database records. The last was Hurricane John in 1994. #hiwxpic.twitter.com/dFY0VvTaX8

html: 54 years ago today, President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the Civil Rights Act, making it illegal to discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. html: I was beaten, left bloody & unconscious while friends of mine gave their lives to ensure that every person has the right to register & vote. But five years ago the SCOTUS Shelby County v Holder decision stuck a dagger in the heart of the Voting Rights Act. We must #RestoreTheVRA
text: I was beaten, left bloody & unconscious while friends of mine gave their lives to ensure that every person has the right to register & vote. But five years ago the SCOTUS Shelby County v Holder decision stuck a dagger in the heart of the Voting Rights Act. We must #RestoreTheVRA

html: Five years ago, the Supreme Court undermined the Voting Rights Act in its Shelby County v. Holder decision, but there is a solution. Today, I’m urging Congress to #RestoreTheVOTE by passing the Voting Rights Advancement Act.
text: Five years ago, the Supreme Court undermined the Voting Rights Act in its Shelby County v. Holder decision, but there is a solution. Today, I’m urging Congress to #RestoreTheVOTE by passing the Voting Rights Advancement Act.

html: The Voting Rights Advancement Act ensures that states with repeated voting rights violations are required to clear their election changes with the Department of Justice. That’s a commonsense voter protection to keep our elections fair. Proud to be a cosponsor. #RestoreTheVOTE
text: The Voting Rights Advancement Act ensures that states with repeated voting rights violations are required to clear their election changes with the Department of Justice. That’s a commonsense voter protection to keep our elections fair. Proud to be a cosponsor. #RestoreTheVOTE

html: The #CARDAct saves consumers $12 BILLION/year. It’s an example of the impact that #consumersfirst laws can have on ppl’s lives & I’m incredibly proud of it. We should be passing more bills that #protectconsumers, not rolling back #DoddFrank like the @GOP is trying to do today.
text: The #CARDAct saves consumers $12 BILLION/year. It’s an example of the impact that #consumersfirst laws can have on ppl’s lives & I’m incredibly proud of it. We should be passing more bills that #protectconsumers, not rolling back #DoddFrank like the @GOP is trying to do today.

html: Credit card companies used to be able to raise interest rates if you made a late payment on a different card. That was a backdoor way to take more $ from people’s wallets. 9 years ago, we banned that in the #CARDAct. I'm proud to have authored this bill that puts #consumersfirst.
text: Credit card companies used to be able to raise interest rates if you made a late payment on a different card. That was a backdoor way to take more $ from people’s wallets. 9 years ago, we banned that in the #CARDAct. I'm proud to have authored this bill that puts #consumersfirst.

html: Did you know that credit card companies used to be able to hit you w a finance charge based not only on your current balance, but on last month’s balance too? That was one of the ways people used to get ripped off but we banned that in my #CARDAct 9 yrs ago & put #consumersfirst
text: Did you know that credit card companies used to be able to hit you w a finance charge based not only on your current balance, but on last month’s balance too? That was one of the ways people used to get ripped off but we banned that in my #CARDAct 9 yrs ago & put #consumersfirst

html: Credit card companies used to be able to raise your interest rates AFTER you made purchases, so people couldn’t know how much something was really going to cost them. Thanks to the #CARDAct, that’s been banned for the last 9 years. #consumersfirst
text: Credit card companies used to be able to raise your interest rates AFTER you made purchases, so people couldn’t know how much something was really going to cost them. Thanks to the #CARDAct, that’s been banned for the last 9 years. #consumersfirst

html: Today's the 9th anniversary of the Credit Cardholders’ Bill of Rights (#CARDAct); a law I authored to put #consumersfirst & ban unfair credit card practices that used to cost us a LOT of $. Big banks fought it but we wouldn’t quit. Now this law is saving ppl $12 BILLION a year.pic.twitter.com/QrP8oQF6ul

html: My grandparents immigrated from Ireland. They came from a rural land & had thick accents. They worked hard & dreamed big. Today, their grandson is a Congressman. Immigrants built this country. Nothing John Kelly or anyone else from the White House says will EVER take that away
text:
My grandparents immigrated from Ireland. They came from a rural land & had thick accents. 

They worked hard & dreamed big. Today, their grandson is a Congressman.

Immigrants built this country. Nothing John Kelly or anyone else from the White House says will EVER take that away

html: Hawaii’s heart is broken this morning as we learn of the passing of one of Hawaii’s greatest statesman. Thank you, Senator Akaka, for your legacy of courage and love. You taught Congress and our nation how to fight with dignity and Aloha. We all aspire to lead like you.
text: Hawaii’s heart is broken this morning as we learn of the passing of one of Hawaii’s greatest statesman. Thank you, Senator Akaka, for your legacy of courage and love. You taught Congress and our nation how to fight with dignity and Aloha. We all aspire to lead like you.

html: Led over 50 members of Congress in calling for cont. funding for preservation of historic sites where Japanese Americans were incarcerated during WWII. This history was a dark period in our past, which is why we have a solemn responsibility to ensure these sites are preserved.pic.twitter.com/HcfkZSQIJ1

html: Remember so it is never repeated. I call upon you to join in the fight to ensure this country never forgets that it imprisoned its people because of their ancestry, not because they committed a crime.
text: Remember so it is never repeated.  I call upon you to join in the fight to ensure this country never forgets that it imprisoned its people because of their ancestry, not because they committed a crime.

html: How ironic that the most decorated unit in military history, the 100th battalion, 442 Regimental Combat Team, fought for a country that considered them enemy aliens. We must never forget our voices or the fact that we must fight so all can remember the injustice.
text: How ironic that the most decorated unit in military history, the 100th battalion, 442 Regimental Combat Team, fought for a country that considered them enemy aliens. We must never forget our voices or the fact that we must fight so all can remember the injustice.

html: When @SecretaryZinke chose to address me in Japanese (when no one else was greeted in their ancestral language), I understood ‘this is precisely why Japanese Americans were treated as they were more than 75 years ago. It is racial stereotyping.
text: When @SecretaryZinke chose to address me in Japanese (when no one else was greeted in their ancestral language), I understood ‘this is precisely why Japanese Americans were treated as they were more than 75 years ago. It is racial stereotyping.

html: These programs tell the horrific stories of 120,000 Japanese American men, women and children, including my grandfathers, who were arrested and imprisoned during World War II.
text: These programs tell the horrific stories of 120,000 Japanese American men, women and children, including my grandfathers, who were arrested and imprisoned during World War II.

html: Last year 23 organizations in seven states received JACS funding totaling $2,869,500 to create curriculum, build infrastructure and finance programs, some at former internment sites like Honouliuli and Sante Fe, New Mexico.

html: My colleagues and I are asking the House to fund creation of a Law Enforcement Assisted Diversion (LEAD) grant program to help combat the opioid epidemic and safeguard against rampant over-incarceration. I'm proud to support this powerful, Seattle-created program.pic.twitter.com/QJ6L9XDpt1
text:
My colleagues and I are asking the House to fund creation of a Law Enforcement Assisted Diversion (LEAD) grant program to help combat the opioid epidemic and safeguard against rampant over-incarceration.

I'm proud to support this powerful, Seattle-created program.pic.twitter.com/QJ6L9XDpt1

html: No better example of why we need continued support for historical sites where the rights of Japanese Americans were violated b/c of race. Zinke's comment betrayed a prejudice that being Asian makes you a perpetual foreigner. Intentional or not, it's offensive. He should apologize https://twitter.com/natemcdermott/status/974361361177333765 …
